title: Cryptocurrency-funded DAOs running charities isn’t as bad as it sounds
content:
Cryptocurrency is becoming a more familiar way to pay for things. One option is as part of a crowd, through a decentralized autonomous organization. In this relatively new kind of group, also called a DAO, decisions and choices are governed by holders of one kind of cryptocurrency token, such as Ethereum or Bitcoin. DAOs also use “smart contracts” that make decisions through online votes by all participants who wish to weigh in and other forms of automation. DAOs are essentially clubs that harness both crowdfunding and cryptocurrency to operate in arenas from art to sports. They are also cropping up…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: Cryptocurrency-funded groups called DAOs are becoming charities – here are some issues to watch out for as we evaluate their efficacy.
